0.user_question: Wayne and Bernadette are movie stars heading to the premiere of their latest film. Bernadette wants to arrive 5 minutes before Wayne. Wayne is staying at a hotel close to the premiere theater, and Bernadette is staying at her high-rise apartment in the same city. The drive from Bernadette’s apartment takes 5891617 times as long as the drive from Wayne’s hotel. If it takes Wayne 5891617 minutes to be driven to the theater, how much earlier should Bernadette leave than Wayne to get to the theater first?

ost_step.1: It takes Wayne 5891617 minutes to reach the theater.
ost_step.2: Bernadette's trip takes x times longer than Wayne's (x=5891617).

direct_answer.text: Let's break down this problem into steps. We know that Bernadette's journey takes several times longer than Wayne's journey. Specifically, we are told here that the time taken by Bernadette is equal to 'x', which equals 5891617 times Wayne's travel time. This means if Wayne took 't' amount of time, then Berndette would take 'xt'. Given these details, since Bernadette needs to arrive 5 mins early compared to Wayne; therefore subtract those 5mins from her overall departure time. Thus, Bernadette should start departing ('b') 5 mins lesser than what Wayne starts so that even though both journeys last till 5891617*t minute mark but when summed up Bertadette arrives exactly 5 min ahead of Wayne. Therefore b+xt=(t)+5 --> solving for 'b': Substitute 'xt' from equation above--> subbing out value:'(5891617)*t+(t)+5 = solution-> Final

direct_answer.text: Firstly let us calculate the distance/time ratio based on what we know about time taken by both travelers (they are moving along parallel paths). Time_Bernardette : Time_Wayne=Distance(A->theatre) / Speed(Car going towards theatre): Distance(Wayne's house -> Theatre)/Speed(same car), since speed remains constant during this journey so cancel out them when calculating Ratio => We obtain TBA:TWH , here TB means Traveler Bernardette & WT means Traveller Wayn . And also note that D represents Total Distances covered while travelling these distances respectively hence BD denotes 'distance traveled by bernie' whereas FWD stands for 'Travel duration till wayn reaches destination'. Based upon above derivation which can further simplified into another form i.e., [TD*SB/(TF*(TB+WS))]=>[(FWD)*SB]/[FWH+(WSH)]; Where SB signifies Start position of Bob ('b') or basically location relative start point wrt origin; While SF indicates Stop factor denoting stopover factors present within route segment being traversed ; SW implies Source Walking Segment indicating any walk segments involved

direct_answer.text: Firstly let us calculate the distance/time ratio based on what we know about time taken by both travelers (they are moving along parallel paths). Time_Bernardette : Time_Wayne=Distance(A->theatre) / Speed(Car going towards theatre): Distance(Wayne's house -> Theatre)/Speed(same car), since speed remains constant during this journey so cancel out them when calculating Ratio => We obtain TBA:TWH , here TB means Traveler Bernardette & WT means Traveller Wayn . And also note that D represents Total Distances covered while travelling these distances respectively hence BD denotes 'distance traveled by bernie' whereas FWD stands for 'Travel duration till wayn reaches destination'. Based upon above derivation which can further simplified into another form i.e., [TD*SB/(TF*(TB+WS))]=>[(FWD)*SB]/[FWH+(WSH)]; Where SB signifies Start position of Bob ('b') or basically location relative start point wrt origin; While SF indicates Stop factor denoting stopover factors present within route segment being traversed ; SW implies Source Walking Segment indicating any walk segments involved
